instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) - No Image/No Backlight
threads.message:
Hi,

I have here an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no image/no backlight.

Water damage:
-> <SIGNAL>WATER_DAMAGE</SIGNAL>.png

Note: 
- External display shows image - so the internal GPU is working fine.
- " <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL> " = 0.007 (diode mode) / 3.4ohms to ground - Is the CPU bad?
- Heat shield on LCD getting warm (<SIGNAL>IMG_0615</SIGNAL>.jpg)
- I have tested several screens - no image/no backlight on all of them
- Logicboard is booting fine / trackpad clicking / touchbar is working / caps lock - green light

Additional issue:
- High fan spin on the left side (all sensors are present)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) - No Image/No Backlight
threads.message:
"External display shows image - so the internal GPU is working fine."
Not really true; tis board doesn't have dedicated GPU.

iGPU core and external video output work, but internal eDP output is damaged; auxiliary channel shorted to ground.
This is the result of direct connection between J8500 and CPU; no series caps present.
There is no way to solve this issue; apart of changing CPU...
